Class Particle

java.lang.Object
Particle
public class Particle extends Object
A Particle moves inside the chambers and can pass through the demon. Each particle has: - A position (`px`, `py`). - A velocity (`vx`, `vy`). - A specific color ("red" or "blue"). Particles move inside their respective chambers, reflecting off the walls.
Version:
1 (Cycle 1)
Author:
Edgar Daniel Ruiz Patiño, Juan Esteban Sánchez García

  • Constructor Details

    • Particle

      public Particle(int px, int py, int vx, int vy, String color)
      Creates a particle at a given position with a velocity and color.
      Parameters:
      px - Initial x-coordinate of the particle.
      py - Initial y-coordinate of the particle.
      vx - Velocity in the x direction (movement per step).
      vy - Velocity in the y direction (movement per step).
      color - The color of the particle ("red" for right chamber, "blue" for left chamber).

  • Method Details

    • makeVisible

      public void makeVisible()
      Makes the particle visible. If the particle is already visible, it does nothing.

    • makeInvisible

      public void makeInvisible()
      Makes the particle invisible. If the particle is already invisible, it does nothing.

    • move

      public void move()
      Moves the particle based on its velocity. Updates both x and y coordinates.

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Gets the current x-position of the particle.
      Returns:
      The x-coordinate of the particle.

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Gets the current y-position of the particle.
      Returns:
      The y-coordinate of the particle.

    • getVx

      public int getVx()
      Gets the velocity in the x direction.
      Returns:
      The x velocity of the particle.

    • getVy

      public int getVy()
      Gets the velocity in the y direction.
      Returns:
      The y velocity of the particle.

    • getColor

      public String getColor()
      Gets the particle's color.
      Returns:
      The color of the particle ("red" or "blue").

    • setVelocity

      public void setVelocity(int newVx, int newVy)
      Sets a new velocity for the particle.
      Parameters:
      newVx - The new velocity in the x direction.
      newVy - The new velocity in the y direction.
